attributes.action: Ensure that all PIP assessment centres are accessible by those who cannot walk
attributes.background: Too many PIP assessment centres are not accessible to people with walking difficulties, in that the nearest car park is too far away, or the assessment rooms are not on the ground floor. The government needs to ensure all assessment centres have accessible parking and disabled lifts.

attributes.action: Produce a clear and costed plan on Brexit before triggering Article 50
attributes.background: Whichever way we voted - leave or remain - we the undersigned, demand that Article 50 is not triggered until there is a clear and costed plan. The U.K's citizens have a right to understand the true implications of leaving the EU before it is legally set in stone.
attributes.additional_details:
What is Article 50?

Article 50 is the technical part of the EU treaty that triggers the withdrawal process from the European Union. 

It's the point of no return.

attributes.action: Allow people resident in UK for 5 years to vote in the 2nd EU Referendum
attributes.background: Non British citizen resident in UK for more than 5 years are a vital part of this country as they are taxpayers and contributing actively to the future of the country. By law they could ask to become British citizens so it's only fair to give them the right to vote in such an important Referendum.

attributes.action: Stop Criminalizing/Banning U.K Drivers For Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving.
attributes.background: Cannabis Users Are Being Driven Off Of The U.K Roads In Staggering Numbers Due To Smoking Cannabis Days Before Driving Why ?
attributes.additional_details:
The Governments Own Drug Advisor's State That Cannabis Can Take Up To 10 Days To Leave The System With Other Sources Saying Up To 67 Days In Chronic Users  
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

While The Nhs Say It Can Show For Weeks 
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/marijuana-facts-teens/want-to-know-more-some-faqs-about-marijuana

And As The High From Cannabis Last No Longer Then A Few Hours How Is This Fair.

attributes.action: Calling for government to pressure foreign governments to stop child soldiers.
attributes.background: The use of chid soldiers in developing countries is worrying. They are used to murder civilians and soldiers alike. In many cases the children would be forced to slaughter there own families. Before the age of 18 they are already in war. we need to fix this.
attributes.additional_details: Currently there is an estimated 250,000 child soldiers, that have been recruited by both governments and rebel groups. Often the children would be forced to murder a family member to sever there connections with community. This makes it hard for them to ever return home. In 10 years; 10 million children have suffered from psychological trauma, 2 million children have been murdered, one million children have been left orphaned and a further 2 million have suffered from life altering injuries.

attributes.action: Introduce homophobia and why it's wrong into secondary school curriculum
attributes.background: We want teachers and students to be more aware about homophobia within schools. By teaching teenagers in their PCSHE lessons about the LGBT community and why it's wrong to discriminate and bully we can help to stop the ever so popular "that's so gay" phrase being used in schools all over the UK.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.stonewall.org.uk/get-involved/education/secondary-schools - This gave us a really big insight on homophobia in schools and how it's much more common than you'd think.

attributes.action: Change marriage law in favour of same sex marriages in the Church in Wales
attributes.background: Like many people I dream of the perfect wedding day -  the Church In Wales played a massive part in my life and I would love to celebrate my marriage in a place that I hold very close to my heart.Marriage law has excluded the church in Wales from being able to celebrate same sex marriages.
attributes.additional_details: Despite a majority vote in favour of the Church in Wales being able to celebrate same sex marriages, the margins were too narrow for it to be passed. Marriage Law has excluded the Church in Wales from being able to celebrate same sex marriages in its churches and cathedrals and there are no plans currently for the Governing Body of the Church in Wales to petition Parliament for change in the near future.  Lets get this petition going and make a change that every one has the right to.

attributes.action: Amnesty for commonwealth illegal skilled immigrants.
attributes.background: In the time of labour government a huge numbers of students came from commonwealth countries but for the immigration cuts like psw tier 1, most of them left United Kingdom. A very few number of them are still surviving in uk in a miserable life, who can do work for the nation for batter future.
attributes.additional_details: The former honorable immigration minister and present prime minister knows everything clearly how they made the condition. So, please take an argent action.

attributes.action: Judicial inquiry into Leave and Remain campaigns with repeat EU Referendum
attributes.background: We request: (i) a full independent judicial inquiry into the conduct of all parties involved with both official, and other, campaigns; and (ii) that the EU Referendum is repeated so that the UK public is able to vote on the basis of fair and balanced, rather than misleading, campaign statements.
attributes.additional_details: The recent EU Referendum was characterised by false and misleading statements from both Leave, Remain and other parties.

attributes.action: Get water companies to remove water meters and stop profiteering from customers.
attributes.background:
Water bills have increased substantially over the last few years.Water companies say that its fairer system.we disagree as hard working families are paying more and  water companies are making bigger profits for their shareholders.
Its unjust and government should stop this profiteering.
attributes.additional_details: Talk to families and check the profit margins of companies responsible for providing water

attributes.action: Ensure 100% broadband coverage for everyone in the UK.
attributes.background: Access to broadband is now a key utility, & in business relied upon as much as water, light and heat. 95% of the UK is covered by some form of broadband connection is fine; denying the remaining 5% - businesses and consumers - (mainly rural areas) is a disgrace; & is creating a two speed country.
attributes.additional_details: Approx. a million businesses & homes — mainly rural areas — will not be receiving superfast broadband by close of 2016, and for those who have poor broadband service, its ‘Universal Service Obligation’ will require homes and businesses in the 5 per cent of areas that don’t yet have fast broadband to request the service & pay for it themselves. It could take until 2020 for the connection to arrive. This petition is to fix this unjust & ensure the Government reverts to their promise 100% service.

attributes.action: Stop the use of the Professional Skills tests (Qualified Teacher Status QTS)
attributes.background: My daughter has ADHD. She's been offered a degree with QTS but failed the tests twice. The format causes sensory issues for her. Why is she not competent when she passed her GCSEs with an AB&C in 2014? Why are we allowing discriminating tests to lose passionate teachers of our future generations?
attributes.additional_details:
All prospective trainee teachers must pass the skills tests before they can be recommended for the award of qualified teacher status (QTS). It consists of two exams, some questions are written and presented in a series of on-screen questions, others are audio with headphones. 
Surely we should be ensuring we train the right people and not place a barrier in their way that appears to be meaningless and provides no evidence to support it has any impact on the selection process?

attributes.action: Free childcare when both parents are working. Not just those who are on benefits
attributes.background: Free childcare is in place for 2 year olds where the parents have low income and mostly on benefits and don't work. If the parents are not working then their children don't need childcare. My husband and I work very hard to provide for our family but have to pay huge amount of money for childcare.
attributes.additional_details: When childcare is paid for when both parents are working it makes a huge dent in income, we could do with the help. All children deserve this, It seems as though I would be better off not working.

attributes.action: Transport Minister Patrick McLoughlin Cap Or Further Subsidise Train Fares
attributes.background: Train fares are just too costly for the average commuter/traveller. 35 minutes away from a main city can cost a yearly total of £3,320.00 which accounts for 12.7% of the average national salary. This figure is too high and continues to increase. Hence, we are calling on a cap or further subsidy.
attributes.additional_details:
"Since privatisation, the average price of a train journey has increased by 22% and walk-on tickets on some routes have been hiked by 245%. The TUC looked at the cost of UK rail commutes against similar European journeys in France, Germany and Spain. It found that we’re paying 3x more of our salary just to get to work and back." - (The Independent) 
http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/uk/why-are-uk-rail-fares-so-expensive-9678640.html

attributes.action: Stop The Council Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!
attributes.background:
I was given 3 separate tickets for driving in a bus lane on a Bank Holiday by Harrow Council, each a few seconds apart.

I do not drive on bus lanes but after my investigation, I realised it was on a bank holiday and I must have assumed because it was bank holiday the same rules on Sunday applies.
attributes.additional_details:
Stop The Council from issuing Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays!

There are many motorists with the same stories. 

http://www.govyou.co.uk/remove-the-ambiguity-re-bank-holiday-use-of-bus-lanes/

http://www.manchestereveningnews.co.uk/news/local-news/warning-reveal-number-drivers-fined-8789712

attributes.action: Legalise Cannabis for Holi. A Hindu practice dating to 1500BC.
attributes.background:
In 2011, there were some 806,199 Hindus living in England.
Cannabis has a holy origin through Lord Shiva. In India, intake of the substance peaks on Holi and Maha Shivrati (Hindu festivals). The legal status of cannabis limits religious freedom and prevents full and proper worship.
attributes.additional_details:
Cannabis is mentioned as a medicinal, magical and sacred plant in the Atharva Veda (dated 2000 - 1400 B.C.) It also calls hemp one of the five kingdoms of herbs which releases us from anxiety and refers to hemp as a "source of happiness", "joy-giver" and "liberator". It is used by millions to cleanse themselves of sin and to please Lord Shiva.
http://www.theatlantic.com/international/archive/2014/03/indias-high-holiday/284448/
https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Entheogenic_use_of_cannabis

attributes.action: Provide 15 hours free childcare for ages between 1year and 3 years old
attributes.background: 30 hours free childcare is provided for children from the ages of 3 but there is nothing in place between the ages of 1 and 3 years of age, limiting mothers returning to work and causing families to struggle with childcare costs.
attributes.additional_details: The government have increased childcare hours to 30 hours free after the age of 3. But there is still nothing in place for children aged between 1 year old and 3 years old. Nurseries are ridiculously expensive and women have a fight between returning to work and having their wages spent on childcare and having nothing left after or not returning to work and still struggling to get by with no income. It's just as hard on joint income families as it is on single parents. Providing 15 hours free childcare between these ages allows mothers to return to work after maternity without the worry of extortionate childcare costs but also provides essential and vital development for children of these ages.

attributes.action: Govt is not entitled to hold a view on the EU referendum, only individuals.
attributes.background: We the undersigned, believe it is unconstitutional and wholly inappropriate, for the UK govt to hold an opinion (Either way) on the potential outcome of the EU referendum and it is certainly not right, to instruct Civil Servants that they may not speak freely on the matter, as they so believe.
attributes.additional_details: We live in a Constitutional Monarchy, with Parliamentary Democracy, however the recent actions of Mr Cameron have turned this country into a Banana Republic. At the very least, Parliament should first debate, whether or not it is right for the Government to use the Civil Service, the way it is intending to, in the lead up to this referendum. Rigging the entire debate as Government, is not providing a free, fair and impartial debate on the issue, to the people, which is what it should be.

attributes.action: Change wording from father and mother to parents on all legal certificates.
attributes.background: In 2014 a bill was won to include mothers names on marriage certificates, this still doesn't reflect the way we live, as some families will be made up of two mothers or two fathers and legal guardians who are ALL the parents of the children.
attributes.additional_details: Yet on many if not all legal certificates and documents only space is there for one mother or one father and then an additional space for parent. If or when a child decides to marry they too will be faced with who to name, as there is space for only one of their mothers or fathers, by changing the wording to parents this will avoid the confusion and recognise the make up of their family.

attributes.action: We ask government to help fund the efforts of "soldiers off the street".
attributes.background: "Soldiers off the street" was founded in 2009, they are a registered charity (1137594 ), their aim is to ensure that no British service man or woman should have to live rough on the streets of the UK, they have already done great things but its time that the UK government chipped in to help out.
attributes.additional_details: "SOTS" are committed to making life better for ex service personnel whose lives have been affected by homelessness. Soldiers off the streets intend to make a positive impact on the lives of the people that have given so much to this country then left to fend for themselves. Many of them with other problems such as Brain shock, Gulf War Syndrome and Post-traumatic Stress Disorder, please get behind this petition, https://www.facebook.com/Soldiers-Off-The-Street-SOTS-146394338732643/timeline

attributes.action: Stop employers from making women redundant whilst on maternity leave
attributes.background: More should be done to protect women on maternity leave from losing their jobs.I was made redundant 4 months into my maternity leave and was left feeling the financial and mental effects of not having a job. Not entitled to redundancy pay or any government support. I now feed my son on £20 a week.
attributes.additional_details: More and more employers use "strategic changes" during maternity leave as a reason to push women out of their business. This causes women and families great distress at a time that should be happy and memorable. Having a child can be a financial shock and adding the pressure of taking someone's income away from them at such a sensitive time can be soul destroying and causes families to become desperate, especially those whom the government doesn't offer any support to.

attributes.action: Do not take away emergency surgery away from Tameside hospital
attributes.background: If anyone is to have a accident around the Tameside area you will have to be taken to Manchester, When Tameside hospital is down graded to a community hospital. This will risk over 300 life's a year taking patients longer to get the help they need. This could be a family member a friend let's say NO
attributes.additional_details:
Manchester evening news printed a story saying around 370 life's will be at risk each year. 

Doctors and nurses at the hospital are not happy about the hospital being downgraded

attributes.action: Prevent sex offenders changing their legal name under which they were convicted.
attributes.background: A recent FOI request has proven that MORE than 800 sex offenders have changed their names to hide their crimes in the last 5 years, including 83 rapists and 126 perverts convicted of possessing or distributing child abuse images, and 88 were convicted of indecent assault and 44 of sexual assault.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.thesun.co.uk/sol/homepage/news/7138397/Sex-offenders-hide-and-change-their-name.html

http://www.dailymail.co.uk/news/article-3582349/More-800-British-sex-offenders-changed-names-hide-dark-past-police-REFUSE-tell-protect-perverts-rights.html

attributes.action: Ensure councils have adequate maintenance funding so Parkruns can remain free
attributes.background: Parkruns are free for people of all ages and abilities, providing benefits for health and the community. Stoke Gifford Parish Council have voted to charge Parkrun. Its free nature means many who otherwise wouldn't or can't participate have made positive impacts on their health and community
attributes.additional_details: Promoting health and exercise will save the government money on the NHS and help keep people healthy

attributes.action: Make taking pictures of children in public without carers consent illegal
attributes.background: My 3yr old neice was photographed at the beach by a stranger, she was specifically targeted, the man followed her around to take the pics, the police were called but because no crime had been commited the man walked free with his phone and there was an uncertainty as to whether the pics were deleted
attributes.additional_details:
Children are extremely vulnerable and I feel that by it being legal for strangers to target and photograph them, this puts them in an even more vulnerable state.
It should not be right for strangers to be allowed to have photographs of our children on their phones. This needs to be stopped.

attributes.action: The government must also put case for leaving the EU on it's referendum leaflet.
attributes.background: I believe that democracy should be fair and that this country should have an honest referendum on it's membership of the EU without the government using tax payers money to fund one side of the argument in a blatant attempt to sway voters to the remain side.
attributes.additional_details: The government is spending £9million on a referendum leaflet.

attributes.action: The Education Secretary should be required to have had real teaching experience
attributes.background: Having 'once been to school' (and especially if it was a fee-paying school) is not a qualification for setting state policy for education. The current and past Education Secretaries generally have no understanding of the pressures faced by modern teachers or pupils.
attributes.additional_details: I recently signed a petition regarding a specific decision on education policy. However, I realised that none of the nonsensical and impractical decision-making would change until someone with a working, practical knowledge of life in a school and classroom takes charge. I would add an addendum that a significant proportion of the executive staff of the Department for Education should also have teaching experience. Education is too important to be a political football for short-term gain.

attributes.action: Funding for every primary school to employ a primary PE teacher
attributes.background: Most primary schools are funded around £9000 per year as a sports premium. From my experience I believe this should be increased and the funding should include the cost of a fully qualified PE teacher to teach curriculum PE in all primary schools.
attributes.additional_details: The benefits of this include; All pupils having a great start in physical education from the age of 4, raise the quality and amount of competitive sport in primary schools, be on par with private school education.

attributes.action: To consider an immediate moratorium on child imprisonment.
attributes.background: Imprisonment is not appropriate for vulnerable children offenders, often from profoundly challenging and damaged backgrounds and with complex overlapping social and mental health needs.
attributes.additional_details: The recent revelations of the abuse by G4S at Medway STC by BBC Panorama; the number of injuries in secure training centres is 5 times higher than official data by Home Office minister Mike Penning, and the scores of deaths each year of incarcerated children. A rethink is urgently required in the interests of child protect and public protection. Care not prisonfare must be the way forward. Prisons do not work to deter or reduce crime and has been shown to exacerbate crime and social injustice.

attributes.action: A ban on airguns and bb guns
attributes.background: Too many of these weapons are ending up in the wrong hands resulting in animals and people becoming targets.if a ban is not possible then they should at least be licenced and monitored!

attributes.action: Palestine formally recognised as an independent state by the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Palestine, once a protectorate of the U K abused by UK foreign policy since 1948, formally be recognised as an independent state. This state based on the borders established in 1948, having full U K recognition as an independent state. Post 1948 Palestine deliberately colonised by a foreign state.
attributes.additional_details: The UN Treaty and Charter formed in 1945 was ratified by the then UK gov. 1948, Human Rights of Palestinian and Jewish peoples were in tension; each a homeland for their own peoples. The international community split Palestine in 1948. This solution was and is highly contentious, with the Palestinian people for the past 70 years suffering and reacting to this decision. The UK needs to demonstrate its equal support to both Israel and Palestine states by treating and recognising them both equally.

attributes.action: Remove all religious representatives from any Parliamentary institution.
attributes.background: Our Government should be 100% secular and should have no religious bias from any religious group. This means removing The Lords Spiritual from the House of Lords and removing any religious ceremony or act from any part of Parliamentary processes.
attributes.additional_details: The lack of secularism in our society promotes inequality through the definition of people and organisations by their affiliation to religious institutions. To combat inequality, our Political Leaders must be independent of all religious influence, irrespective of the religion, so that all decisions can be made in a fair and balanced way. This independence cannot be accomplished whilst we have members of one religious institution in Parliament in any form.

attributes.action: Enforce equal and nondiscriminatory insurance policies for young drivers.
attributes.background: Young drivers aged 18+ face extremely unfair and ridiculous insurance fees for car insurance. These vary from £10,000 to well over £50,000, often costing 4/5 times the price of a car itself. How is it i am mature enough to have two jobs whilst attending college, but not drive a car affordably.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies are exploiting young drivers at rates which many can not afford. This behaviour goes completely against the whole notion of equality which Britain prides itself upon and discriminates heavily against the young and disabled preventing them from having equal opportunities in life as those who are older.

attributes.action: Make the minimum hourly wage for residential & domicilary care workers £10phr.
attributes.background: I'm shocked and appalled at the hourly rate of pay offered by care homes. Most start at the current minimum wage of £7.20phr, it's known some pay as little as £5.00phr. The work is incredibly demanding mentally, physically and emotionally, & one which vulnerable adults rely entirely on their carers.
attributes.additional_details:
Over the years there have been a number of newspaper articles chronicling the poor wages on offer to care workers. Such as in the Independent, guardian & on the bbc websites.
By paying a more realistic and professional hourly rate:
- The industry can and will attract better quality carers who will feel valued and see the job as a profession.
- Those being cared for will be getting the best carers. 
- It would help reduce the number of families claiming Tax credits, to supplement their income.

attributes.action: Stop Prison 'Reform' from going ahead. More rights for victims please!
attributes.background: The Queen detailed prison reform in her speech today, which includes giving prisoners the right to live at home on weekdays and free iPads with Skype to contact family while serving time. This is not punishment and makes a joke of the victim's rights.

attributes.action: Ban mobile phones in the House
attributes.background: After seeing the reactions to the call for George Osborne to apologise all we can see from the Tory front bench is laughing at their mobile phones and texting. The use of mobile phones at work is generally banned and I think the same rule should stand in Parliament.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ygQykstDk2w

attributes.action: pension age to remain at age 65, if you Left school at 15 years of age.
attributes.background: The Government are raising the age of retirement for people who were borne after 1952, to 66 years of age, these are people who started work when they were 15 years of age.

attributes.action: Adopt a zero tolerance approach to acts of racism, in the wake of the referendum
attributes.background: Since the EU referendum, there have been numerous accounts of racism and xenophobia, where people who are in the UK legally are being abused, assaulted and/or told to "go home". A zero tolerance stance is required to show that racism and xenophobia has no place in the UK, whether in the EU or not.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for alcoholic drinks to display it's nutritional information
attributes.background: It is the law to display nutritional information on all food and drink except for alcoholic drinks. Many people use this information for any dietary issues they may have, from a simple diet to type 1 diabetes. Without nutritional information it is impossible to consume alcohol for some people.
attributes.additional_details: Alcohol is extremely calorific and I believe people would change their views on how much they drink if they knew what was in what they drink. Also being diabetic myself, I have to use insulin depending on how much carbohydrate I consume, which is impossible to know with alcohol, and could pose and extremely dangerous health risk.

attributes.action: to make immigrants work and pay tax for 4 years before they can claim benefits.
attributes.background: this is one of the big reasons why people chose to voted out of the EU, we have now chosen to leave the EU and we should no longer be giving immigrants housing benefits, working tax credits or job seekers allowance from a system that they have never paid into. This should be stoped immediately.
attributes.additional_details: we have a great benefits system that is here to help British citizens, the system was not put in place to pay people money for doing nothing, if an immigrant wants to claim any benefits they should have been living, working and paying tax into the system for 4 years minimum before they can claim any benifits.

attributes.action: Simplify the motorcycle test
attributes.background: Since the implementation of directive 2006/126/EEC the UK motorcycle test has become unnecessarily complicated and prohibitively expensive.
attributes.additional_details: The closed circuit part of the test that ensures riding at 50 KMH is totally irrelevant. We wish to see a structured sensible test similar to the previous test that provided safe training and restricted access to powerful bikes for a short period as we believe this was the most successful version of motorcycle testing. We believe that structured training is preferable to complicated legislation as a way to reduce accidents.

attributes.action: Ban pre packed cooked bones being sold as dog treats
attributes.background:
Many dog owners are unaware of the dangers of giving their dog cooked bones. 
Lots of shops in the uk (not just pet shops) sell pre packed cooked bones as dog treats which are sold to dog owners everyday! Cooked bones can be deadly to dogs and many die every year because of this

attributes.action: Allow Doctors to Issue Temporary Disabled Parking Badges
attributes.background: Many people leave hospital and are vulnerable and have extremely limited mobility. I believe GPs and Doctors should be able to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help people with temporary issues
attributes.additional_details:
Many people leave hospital have had invasive or life changing surgery and are signed off work for weeks or even moths to recover. During this time no provision is made to help them access shops, pharmacists or even hospitals!

I would like to empower Doctors to issue temporary Disabled Parking Badges to help post operative patients rehabilitate.

These badges would give the bearer the same access rights as the current Disabled Badge scheme however they would expire as patients recover.

attributes.action: Outlaw mobile safety cameras or prove they improve road safety
attributes.background: Mobile safety cameras or mobile speed cameras, they appear in places with no warnings to motorists, fine if you're not speeding but prove that they are improving road safety! Where I live accidents are minimal we have no speed cameras just the van that shows up and no warning signs before you see it
attributes.additional_details: It's about time a proper debate was had about these! If they are just to target those who pay no attention place a sign before it can target a motorist let them know there is a police operation in progress! Show is proof that they actually improve road safety and reduce accidents in areas they are used! Modern technology on cars does though that has been proven time and time again! Raise speed limits of you are to continue to use these cash cows or give plausible warnings that they are in action

attributes.action:
Make large corporations with "off shore" activity pay a 30% 
UK operating tax.
attributes.background: Corporations that operate in the UK can legally get away with out paying any tax to the state by going through various loop holes in the system. So we are calling for OUR government, people that we have put in place to work for US, we the people to charge these companies a UK operating tax of 30%
attributes.additional_details: The rate of 30% is to be paid from profits of said company and will be estimated by the government and checked with the companies own accounts and billed to the off shore company. (Much like when the HMRC decides how much tax a UK citizen should have paid if there is any discrepancy in end of year  accounts.)  If the company disagrees then they will be served a notice to close all remaining branches and leave the country.

attributes.action: Scrap 20% VAT on memorial headstones and the service provided by memorial masons
attributes.background:
Recently my 5 year daughter 'fell asleep' and i was shocked to find out that VAT is applied on memorial headstones ,memorial vases etc. 
How is VAT allowed in the first place, could someone explain to me how its a value added tax when you lose someone suddenly and unexpectedly.
attributes.additional_details: Currently charities and faith groups are allowed to claim back VAT through the Memorial Grant Scheme so can this not be opened up to the general public or VAT not applied or together.

attributes.action: Make sure refugees and immigrants are vaccinated to the same standard as uk
attributes.background: We are now seeing cases of bugs and diseases that's not been an issue for years in UK. Our children are starting to suffer for longer periods and more often. As a parent I'm getting concerned about about my children's health and have a 3 year old that's constantly getting ill
attributes.additional_details: As the country is allowing refugees and immigrants from various locations it's time to think of our children's health welfare and theirs. We need to ensure our children don't pick up various bugs that have become less common in the last 20 years or so. Please support us to petition the government to ensure all new British citizens are given vaccinations up to the level that we all are

attributes.action: Admit all children with a British connection to the UK from the French camps.
attributes.background: The clearance policy agreed by French courts and the French government's use of water cannon in executing it in these weather conditions, is against common humanity.

attributes.action: Make David Cameron personally fund his folly trips within the EU
attributes.background: David Cameron is going back and forth to various meetings with various leaders to argue for reform but the have all refused the terms set out by our Prime Minister.  It won't happen!  At least make him pay for his and his entourage travel, accommodation and food personally from his own resources.

attributes.action: Fund Home Schooling For SEN Children that cannot access mainstream schools
attributes.background: My two children have autism spectrum disorder and also suffer with anxiety. They find going into the school impossible. Since taking them out of school they are doing fantastic. But this as caused us to reduce our working hours and causes us financial problems. All we need is a little help
attributes.additional_details: If like with in elderly care a percentsge of the money set aside for a childs education could be paid to parents to home educate a child with special educational needs. It would enable child to recieve a good quality home education and relieve the financial burdon on the family.
